title: The concurrence of three climatic events
dot:
digraph ClimateEvents{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];subgraph cluster_1{label="Dramatic Climate Events (June 2023)";style=dashed;Antarctic[label="1. Antarctic Sea-Ice
Record Low Extent
- 2 million km below
1991-2020 mean
- More open ocean
- Solar radiation absorption", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightcoral];Global_Temp[label="2. Global 2m Surface
Temperatures
- Breached 1.5°C
- 4.8 standard deviations
above 1979-2000 mean", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightcoral];Ocean_Temp[label="3. North Atlantic
Ocean Temperatures
- Unprecedented daily
records
- Influenced by
various factors", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightcoral];}subgraph cluster_2{label="Contributing Factors";style=dashed;EEI[label="Earth Energy Imbalance
- 1.61 Watts/m²
- Equivalent to 13
Hiroshima bombs/sec", fillcolor=lightyellow];IMO2020[label="IMO 2020
- Reduced sulfur content
in fuels
- Led to rapid ocean
heating", fillcolor=lightyellow];Sahara_Dust[label="Lack of Sahara Dust
- Typically cools ocean
by blocking sunlight", fillcolor=lightyellow];ElNino[label="El Niño
- Drives surface heating
in Eastern Tropical Pacific", fillcolor=lightyellow];Tonga[label="Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha’apai
Volcanic Eruption
- Potentially accelerates
warming", fillcolor=lightyellow];}subgraph cluster_3{label="Consequences";style=dashed;Heatwaves[label="Record Heatwaves
- Intensity, duration,
and frequency", fillcolor=lightgreen];Crop_Failures[label="Crop Failures
- Impact on food
security", fillcolor=lightgreen];Climate_Migration[label="Increased Climate
Migration", fillcolor=lightgreen];Infrastructure[label="Infrastructure
Failures", fillcolor=lightgreen];}Antarctic->EEI;Global_Temp->ElNino;Ocean_Temp->IMO2020;Ocean_Temp->Sahara_Dust;Ocean_Temp->Tonga;EEI->Heatwaves;EEI->Crop_Failures;EEI->Climate_Migration;EEI->Infrastructure;Antarctic->Heatwaves;Global_Temp->Heatwaves;Ocean_Temp->Heatwaves;}
